description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

BTS guideline for O₂ use in adults in healthcare and emerg settings - https://www.brit-thoracic.org.uk/document-library/guidelines/emergency-oxygen/bts-guideline-for-oxygen-use-in-adults-in-healthcare-and-emergency-settings/
http://www.lhp.leedsth.nhs.uk/detail.aspx?id=1979
https://pulmonaryrehab.com.au/importance-of-exercise/use-of-supplemental-oxygen/

details.purpose: To record details of a request for supplemental oxygen for an individual, in both acute care and at home.
details.use: Use to record details of a request for supplemental oxygen for an identified individual, in both acute care and at home.

items.items: A request for supplemental oxygen for an individual who is breathing spontaneously.
The target levels of oxygenation that is appropriate for the individual.
The rate of flow of oxygen delivered to the delivery device.
Oxygen is delivered at a constant flow rate throughout the 24 hour period.
At various times of the day or during activities specified using the 'Timing' CLUSTER.
Duration of each administration of supplemental oxygen.
Redundant if 'Continuous' is selected in the 'Mode' data element.
Structured desciption of the timing of intermittent administration within a 24 hour period.
Redundant if 'Continuous' is selected in the 'Mode' data element.
Also known as 'PRN (pro re nata)' or 'PN (per necessare)'.
Total administration of supplemental oxygen over a 24 hour period.
Redundant if 'Continuous' is selected in the 'Mode' data element. For example: 'at least 15 hours per day'.
Specific activity that requires supplemental oxygen.
Redundant if 'Continuous' is selected in the 'Mode' data element.
Delivered while at rest and awake.
Delivered at night or while sleeping.
Delivered during exercise or activities of daily living.
Flag if the order requires PAP.
Structured details about the delivery device.
For example: 'nasal prongs'; or 'V40, Venturi mask 40%'.
The clinical reason for supplemental use of oxygen.

For example: 'Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease'; or 'Obstructive sleep apnea'. Coding of the clinical indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences to enable recording of multiple conditions.
The therapeutic goal for use of supplemental oxygen.
For example: 'symptom relief'; or 'increase exercise tolerance'.
Urgency of the request for oxygen.

Specific definitions of emergency and urgent will vary between clinical contexts, clinical systems and the clinical scenario. If explicit timing is required then the Order start and expiry times should be clearly stated.
The order does not require immediate or prioritised attention.
The individual will require equipment that allows them to be ambulatory or mobile.
The individual will not require equipment that allows them to be ambulatory or mobile.
The date/time when supplemental oxygen order commences.
Only required if the start date/time is different to the date/time when this order is recorded.
The date/time when supplemental oxygen order ceases.
The order is open ended and has no end date.
Additional narrative about the supplemental oxygen order not captured in other fields.
Narrative description about the supplemental oxygen order.
This data element should be used to describe the named service in more detail, including how it should be delivered, patient concerns and issues that might be encountered in delivering the order.
The local identifier assigned by the requesting clinical system.
Usually equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.
Details about the clinician or organisation ordering the supplemental oxygen.
The local identifier assigned to the request by the clinician or organisation receiving the order.
Usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.
Details about the clinician or organisation receiving the order.
The status of the order as indicated by the requester.
Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information. Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Details of additional clinicians, organisations or agencies who require copies of any communication.
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
